en: Welcome to [pulse freq=2][color=MEDIUM_VIOLET_RED]Spud Customs![/color][/pulse]
This training will teach you the [wave amp=15 freq=2][color=DARK_ORANGE]essential skills[/color][/wave] needed to protect Spud's borders.
You've been selected for a vital role: [color=DARK_ORANGE]Border Customs Officer[/color].
Immigrating potatoes will line up outside your office here.
To start processing potatoes, you need to open your booth for service with the switch here.
You'll signal each potato to approach your office by tapping the megaphone.
Potatoes will enter the booth one by one and present their documents.
First, move their documents over to the inspection table for a better look.
Then, look for [tornado radius=3 freq=2][color=YELLOW]expired dates, incorrect information, or signs of forgery[/color][/tornado].
Your desk has stamps for marking documents, you can click here to pull the stamp bar out.
Then place the document under the stamp you want...
Click the stamp to mark documents as [color=CHARTREUSE]approved[/color] or [color=CRIMSON]rejected[/color]...
And drag the document back to the potato to finalize your decision!
Sometimes, potatoes will try to [color=CRIMSON]rush past your checkpoint[/color].
You have a direct uplink in your booth, which allows you to control [pulse freq=3][color=CRIMSON]missile launchers[/color][/pulse] along the border wall.
Click on these "runners" to launch a missile and stop them.
Remember, each runner that gets through will count as a [wave amp=20 freq=3][color=CRIMSON]strike against you[/color][/wave].
Too many strikes, and your shift will end... [tornado radius=3 freq=3][color=CRIMSON]permanently.[/color][/tornado]
Each shift has a [color=DARK_ORANGE]quota of potatoes[/color] you need to process to finish your day.
Your score keeps track of your performance compared to your fellow officers at this checkpoint, and officers in distant customs offices.
After each shift, you'll see a summary of your performance, and whether you succeeded or failed in your duty.
You'll see a breakdown of how you handled runners, and how many documents you processed.
Plus any bonuses you earned from processing documents quickly, perfectly aligning stamps, or perfectly striking runner potatoes.
You'll also receive a performance rating based on how well you processed potatoes during your shift, and up to 3 golden stamps if you exceed expectations.
Here you can submit your score for each shift to the global database of customs officers and see how you compare to the most elite customs officers around the world.
If your shift was successful, you'll be able to move on by clicking "Continue" and starting your next shift.
Your job is simple. Potatoes arrive at your booth, you check their documents, and you decide who gets through.
I'll guide you through the basics [color=YELLOW]step by step[/color]. Follow the prompts and you'll get the hang of it.
The safety and security of Spud depends on your [pulse freq=2][color=DARK_ORANGE]vigilance![/color][/pulse]
Let's begin your [color=YELLOW]training shift[/color]...
But be careful - not every potato has their papers in order.
[color=RED]Expired passports[/color] are an automatic rejection. No exceptions.
